content: simple double_crochet or shell beanie hat supplies- 1-2 skein worsted weight yarn ~ 200g or 250 yards of main color us size h hook/ 5mm pattern abbreviations used are for standard us style crochet starter ring chain 4 st slip st into 1st chain to form a ring alternatively use the magic loop start method crown row 1 chain 3 counts as first double_crochet double_crochet 12 times into ring slip_stitch into top of chain 3 - 13 total sts row 2 chain 3 double_crochet into same st double_crochet twice into each st around slip_stitch into top of chain 3 - 26 total sts row 3 chain 3 * 1dc into next st double_crochet twice into next st repeat around from * around end slip_stitch into top of chain 3 - 39 total sts row 4 chain 3 * 1dc into next 2 sts double_crochet twice into next st repeat around from * around end slip_stitch into top of chain 3 - 42 total sts row 5 chain 3 * 1dc into next 3 sts double_crochet twice into next st repeat around from * around end slip_stitch into top of chain 3 - 55 total sts row 6 chain 3 * 1dc into next 4 sts double_crochet twice into next st repeat around from * around end slip_stitch into top chain of chain 3 - 68 total sts double_crochet hat option row 7 chain 3 1dc in every st around end slip_stitch into chain 3 repeat until hat is deep enough try changing colors for interesting stripes use up stashed bits of leftovers from other projects shell pattern hat option row 7 chain 3 double_crochet into same st * skip 2 sts double_crochet 5 times into st skip 2 sts single_crochet repeat around from * around end with single_crochet skip 2 sts double_crochet twice into same st as chain 3 single_crochet into top chain of chain 3 row 8 skip 2 sts * double_crochet 5 sts into single_crochet skip 2 sts single_crochet repeat from * around end slip_stitch into single_crochet repeat row 7 & 8 until hat is deep enough a single row of shell on a double crocheted hat is a nice touch if you want to keep it very basic chasing a thread -
